author: thenateway
content: > Withdrawal credentials aren't used for voluntary exits, it requires a signed message from the validator key

author: thenateway
content: this makes staking services a bit trickier. Customers can't exit if a staking service doesn't uphold their end of the deal

author: thenateway
content: since only the validator key (controlled by the staking service) can be used to exit voluntarily. so the customer has to wait until they get ejected if a staking-service is deliquent

author: jgm
content: <@!690731283944570931> there has been a discussion about this on the eth2.0-specs github.  An immediate solution is to provide the staker with a pre-signed voluntary exit transaction.

author: collin.myersobolnetwork
content: Would users pre sign this transaction during the deposit flow?

author: jgm
content: Staking services would provide the transaction.  Of course, getting it to the staker safely may be a challenge
